definition: Hui-zi also known as Hui Shi 惠施[Hui4 Shi1] (c. 370-310 BC), politician and philosopher of the School of Logicians 名家 [Ming2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)

son/child/seed/egg/small thing/1st earthly branch: 11 p.m.-1 a.m., midnight, 11th solar month (7th December to 5th January), year of the Rat/Viscount, fourth of five orders of nobility 五等爵位[wu3 deng3 jue2 wei4]/ancient Chinese compass point: 0° (north)

sentences.english: Huizi felt that Chuang Tzu did it too far.
sentences.chinese: 惠子覺得莊子這樣的行爲實在是太過分了。

sentences.english: Yamagata, 57, let out a yelp as she hurried out into the street.
sentences.chinese: 57歲的千惠子大叫了一聲，匆忙奔到街上。

sentences.english: Huizi said that she had been crying since she came back home, without any reason being given.
sentences.chinese: 惠子說她一到屋就哭，問她什麼都不說。

sentences.english: I'm HuiZiHao, nine years old this year, in the north pond experimental primary school.
sentences.chinese: 我叫惠子皓，今年九歲，在北塘實驗小學上學。

sentences.english: The creations of Saeko Tagagi have sensitive emotions and use unique techniques.
sentences.chinese: 紗惠子的創作，擁有細膩的感情與獨特的技巧。

sentences.english: Kim Hye-ja, who plays the title role in 'Mother,' took the award for best actress.
sentences.chinese: 在該片中飾演母親一角的金惠子榮獲最佳女主角獎。

sentences.english: There is no place I would rather be than with you and Keiko.
sentences.chinese: 除了與你和惠子在一起，我哪兒也不願去。

sentences.english: Kim Hye-ja, who plays the title role in 'Mother, ' took the award for best actress.
sentences.chinese: 在該片中飾演母親一角的金惠子榮獲非常佳女主角獎。

definition: (onom.) ting-a-ling (in compounds such as 玎玲 or 玲瓏|玲珑)/tinkling of gem-pendants
Michiko, Japanese female given name/Empress Michiko of Japan (1934-)
Hui Shi, also known as Hui-zi 惠子[Hui4 zi5](c. 370-310 BC), politician and philosopher of the School of Logicians 名家 [Ming2 jia1] during the Warring States Period (475-220 BC)
one of the three main divisions of the Book of Songs 詩經|诗经
Itō or Itoh, Japanese surname/Ito-Yokado (supermarket) (abbr. for 伊藤洋華堂|伊藤洋华堂)
